channel.title: Life is depressingly pointless yes?
channel.description:
Every now and then something cracks inside my brain and i get hit by the severe want to actually achieve something worthwhile in my life. Something out of the ordinary.
Which is quickly followed by the crushing realization that life isnt fair, and I, along with virtually anyone else i can possibly know, is going to die without achieving anything other than getting a soul crushing job, marrying a no doubt soul crushing woman and raising several soul crushing kids so that they can grow up to lead boring soul crushing existences.
I would sooner shoot myself in the head than live a life that is the same every week, and mimics 99% of everyone elses life.
I used to play Runescape to idle my time away, since it made me feel like i was achieving something. After that started to suck, i moved onto World of Warcraft.
Ive evolved beyond the want to play games to waste away my time, and now need to achieve something... or at least give my meaningless existence something thatl make it stand out against everyone else.
If i take a step back and look, i know for a fact i have several ideas that could catapult me into more money than i could possibly spend in 7 life times. But thats just it... im an ideas man. I couldnt possibly create any of the things i come up with, i either need programmers, money or people. All of which are always out of reach.
So... what do you people do to take away the drudgery of your pointless lives? Also... any suggestions as to what i could possibly aim for that is worth while, dont hesitate to advise.

item.title: Life is depressingly pointless yes?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

exe626:

I’ve been fighting the failures in my life for as long as I can remember. Things have only gotten worse.

It’s quite obvious that fighting the failures in your life in way thats against the law will make your situation even worse.

Of course it sucks for you that you are in this situation, but it’s mainly your own fault.

Read full topic

item.title: Life is depressingly pointless yes?
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

[quote=“exe626, post:109, topic:245089”]it would cost less than $50 to drive to canada from where i live, and less than a 4 hour drive. i’m trying to find a job still, may be impossible until i’m 18. i’ll pay to get my license again, and i’ll need them soon because my mom plans to kick me out when i’m 18.

[quote author=Ske link=topic=321499.msg2579416#msg2579416 date=1229169688]
exe626, it may sound cliché , but if you really believe in yourself you can achieve something.
[/quote]I’ve been fighting the failures in my life for as long as I can remember. Things have only gotten worse.[/quote]

Forget about your failures. Let it go; it’s in the past and you can’t change it (Unless you hack into yuor cirminal reocrds and edit them ??? ) And I’m sure plenty of people will be there to remind you about it.

Consider the following: There are 2 kinds of people in this world, those who live just to get by, and those who live to do something. The ones who live just to get by spend alot of their free time doing nothing, and won’t act until their lifestyle is threatened. You can find them everywhere (Moparscape is a good place to look). The ones who live to do something are nearly always, well, doing something. Which are you ?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Ske Ske
item.description:
@Ske wrote:

exe626, it may sound cliché , but if you really believe in yourself you can achieve something.

I think you should get an undeclared work(i dont know if thats the right word).
Like those chinese restaurants, they hire people with a criminal past, immigrants,… you know what i mean.
You could make some money without stealing and when you have enough, then go to canada just like you wanted.
There’s always a way out, there are so many possibilities but you refuse to get ideas because you’re stuck with the thought that says you’re a failure.

item.title: Life is depressingly pointless yes?
item.dc:creator: @Microsoft2 Microsoft®
item.description:
@Microsoft2 wrote:

[quote=“exe626, post:99, topic:245089”]Well, for starters, I didn’t drop out of school. I was kicked out. I’ve been kicked out so many times that, this time, they made it forever. They weren’t going to do until I was 18, but my mom is a bitch and hates me anyways, so she signed the form for me to be kicked out. When I was younger, I damaged more than $150,000 in property. I have 30~ assault counts. I’ve been arrested 3 times for “gang-related activity”. Arrested multiple times for general fighting. I went to juvy when I was 13, got out when I was 14. I’ve stolen more property than most of you own, which I had to do community service to pay for, then give them the items and money back. I was just arrested recently while driving because, evidently, going 5 mph under the speed limit is against the law, which got my license taken away. Now I can’t drive. I didn’t have the money to, anyways.

There’s more, I can’t remember everything.[/quote]

wtf where do you live?
What are you good at? There must be something you enjoy doing. Move countries and start climbing back up the ladder. Why did you steal and why were you kicked out?

Read full topic

Plenty of people made it big in their life without even getting education.
When you say “i have no future” you are actualy limiting yourself.[/quote]I don’t have a future. That’s written in stone. My life is over. I can’t get a GED, I can’t get a job, I can’t get a diploma, I can’t achieve anything with the criminal record I haul with me everywhere. My mind and my peers have all rejected me. It’s time for me to go.[/quote]
criminal record? what did you do?

[/quote]
For those who are Christian, I always wonder why ‘god’, if he really exists, made the earth in the first place. If we all go to heaven, why don’t we just start our lives there?[/quote]

item.title: Life is depressingly pointless yes?
item.dc:creator: @Ske Ske
item.description:
@Ske wrote:

Squigglyo , i used to think the exact same thing like you.
This is because my life is boring and always the same routine.(go to school, go home, study, school,…)
Yes, i do have a life and no, im not emo or something.
Other kids my age seem perfectly fine, they enjoy life and they’re usually happy.
but with me, It just feels like something is missing in my life and i won’t be happy until i achieve what i truly want.

exe626:

Teachers don’t do shit. You learn more outside of school than you do in.

Couldn’t agree more.
People nowadays confuse intelligence with knowledge, wich are in my opinion 2 completely different things.

[quote=“exe626, post:45, topic:245089”]I’m have no future. I have a bad criminal record and I’m dropping out of high school. I’ve been living in poverty my entire life. I was going to go to an art school, but they called me today and told me, that with the amount of money I make, I wont be able to attend. I go on the computer to escape all of that. I have friends here, lots of them. They make life easier in this virtual world.

Someday, I hope to get married. Have a kid or 2. That’d make me the happiest man alive. Yet, here you are, downing the idea as if it’s something bad? I met the most perfect girl, and someday, things might happen. She’s turned my life around. A month ago, I was ready to drive off into a lake, but here I am today, all because of her.

Maybe you just need a woman?[/quote]
You see,you’re already wrong on your first sentence.
“I have no future.” Why? Because you dropped out of high school?
Plenty of people made it big in their life without even getting education.
When you say “i have no future” you are actualy limiting yourself.

seand:

[quote]My problem is ive taken a step back and analysed everything from far too far away. Why are we here? Whats our purpose? etc. Thats why i was saying eveything seems pointless, because once your dead, your life was next to pointless. So what was the point in spending those 90 years to just end up dying?

no, your problem is that the big picture you think you’re looking at is so pathetically small that you have this great new contorted way of looking at life. if you think you’re going to do something important enough to affect the entire universe, go ahead and get ready to be disappointed. even if anyone were important enough to have that effect, i doubt it would be you, seeing as you don’t even have enough motivation to follow through with some of your money-making ideas.

and i don’t really understand your thought process - you ask what the point is of living for 90 years if you’re just going to end up dying? what the hell do you want? do you want to live forever so you have more time to do something great? and how do you even define “great”? something people will remember you by? do you think albert einstein cares that people still study his work, or thomas edison cares that the entire world uses light bulbs because he invented them? obviously not, they’re dead. either you don’t understand this concept, or you want to be able to look back at something you did and take satisfaction in the fact that it affected a large number of people. i’m assuming you’re not an idiot, and that it’s the latter, which brings us back to the pursuit of happiness, what so many have already said. obviously you’re a bit questionable on what makes you happy, seeing as you have a fiance and still think your life seems pointless, which would imply that you should do some exploring. maybe you’ll find something that makes you happy, and maybe you won’t. but at the very least you’ll make your life less dull by stirring it up with new things.[/quote]
Here it is, a perfect example of an ignorant person.(not trying to offend you or something )
“…go ahead and get ready to be disappointed” Now thats the type of mentality most unsuccessful people have.
If you don’t even bother trying something, then how will you know you would fail?
Did Thomas Edison have the same mentality as you do?
It’s like people are brainwashed into believing that they should live a meaningless life and earn 2000 a month while spending their free time in front of the television.

That’s the problem, most people quit before they even start, because they’re already thinking of a more “realistic” life.

Oh and, nice forum by the way

Read full topic
